1B2985920FCC4851877A881011A3D48A.description: Explain major differences between books that tell stories and books that give information, drawing on a wide reading of a range of text types.

11784CFD1E474E0CB2DA3A609B61009A.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

5F4CDCF33F98476F81A7FF4D687D3C61.description: Identify words and phrases in stories or poems that suggest feelings or appeal to the senses.

1E8D06592DB34D6BA6E44F57CB4C2779.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

5F103AE4032743EEB233BBB5BF6FE6BB.description: Use effective strategies to determine unknown words in text.

5CC51C9D51614CA0ABFCED6F9CBB7887.description: With prompting and support, identify and describe characters, settings, and major events in a story.

6E129C4A4F43448E9B01318B89B79B27.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details, and demonstrate understanding of their central message or lesson.

168D5E62E8CF437E9D29797533F4428C.description: With and without prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in text.

A1EF1C6F41C443A5B43A23C75E450B84.description: Demonstrate comprehension strategies of questioning, predicting, clarifying, and summarizing.

F1A06789E3394BF29DD6CCC8F2E15A20.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

4BA42650EFAB4457A74E3C4F8AB8C641.description: Listen and follow along as teacher models fluency.

790E4E68C1134090A9DD78D7177E1F69.description: Read on-level text in successive readings with purpose and understanding, and sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

32D6A617B75A470F96659D437D0A7E0E.description: Perform basic hardware and software operations (e.g., copy and paste, navigate among open windows, undo/redo).

E284F43717874B749796BBCFF706D294.description: Communicate about technology using developmentally appropriate and accurate terminology (e.g., be able to identify and refer to parts of the computer with proper terms).

5B9CAF95390A4FC6AA3EA539639A5E93.description: Through print and oral work, give in-depth meaning of level appropriate words (e.g., words that are basic and concrete and are used in daily conversation).

12A2E9764C1C42CBB0F859439902FE2B.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts, including using frequently occurring conjunctions, to signal simple relationships (e.g., because).

27CFB1F6F1794851963E12FF58658CB6.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

E8D87F09824A4EC49A7F90A024A7B987.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs differing in manner (e.g., look, peek, glance, stare, glare, scowl) and adjectives differing in intensity (e.g., large, gigantic) by defining or choosing them or by acting out the meanings.

2E2A07F5ABE14C2E942C1B22F4FE19F4.description: Distinguish various meanings of verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance).

EC2D979AEF7B4830B1ABC8486F1E6C12.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note a situation that is pleasant).

2197E19407CB4C01A8738C178D922928.description: Define words by category and by one or more key attributes (e.g., a duck is a bird that swims; a tiger is a large cat with stripes).

88E90343D0114A93A2743DD417296E53.description: Sort words into categories (e.g., colors, clothing) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

AB0B0423B07541BAAC2EC1B125F4145F.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g. shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

8C97E33778D24B17ADFC6DEA55D5477D.description: With guidance and support, demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

5EFA0C0372804936B3F09BC1FCDA69DE.description: Identify frequently occurring root words (e.g., look) and their inflectional forms (e.g., looks, looked, looking).

0E01795D88C04ACAAC840D71F0BAAAD2.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, -un, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

D050FEC354B849EB94D3ABE132989B3A.description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

9DE5A3BFA49F4F8DA348BF107EA6B480.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

DECDB446DCED45E58475065D3B1F0398.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on appropriately leveled content utilizing an array of strategies.

5096D322DB0F48C99596FF96C0AD893D.description: Recognize and read level appropriate irregularly spelled words.

F9D1EE8D921B4634AF97B571DF41F36B.description: Decode two-syllable words following basic patterns by breaking the words into syllables.

1A39964B9DB2424F8BBF5EE8F4066ACF.description: Use knowledge that every syllable must have a vowel sound to determine the number of syllables in a printed word.

E1570139932541E5812769C15131E7AF.description: Know final –e and common vowel team conventions for representing long vowel sounds.

6611F43081844F2AAE99C005C4F6AD20.description: Know the spelling-sound correspondences for common consonant digraphs.

F1B20D2613894CAC92AC3D98E34310DB.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

1C3220288DB64C4E8C92BA82404725E3.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

53489DB7C50E4304B3589E2753DFE667.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

98733E0F375444F0BAB5DCA0CFBB48D5.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary or the most frequent sound for each consonant.

9623D4D15AB0479D845F0144A35E7790.description: Know and apply level appropriate phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

C4510A1F33FF40718CF3026F84D1A630.description: Segment spoken single-syllable words into their complete sequence of individual sounds (phonemes).

813B9147E99C43D68BE9F6C7B3673B9B.description: Isolate and pronounce initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in spoken single-syllable words.

D8235E84279848DCBD577723A3E48908.description: Orally produce single-syllable words by blending sounds (phonemes) including consonant blends.

7B2E71FA1B1840188ADE2FD0D3217D4C.description: Distinguish long from short vowel sounds in spoken single-syllable words.

649546BEBC0E4A47B45E16C56322DF4E.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

comments: This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.
EB7D12F28B5642408F42306940B2CA5A.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words.

F1C49FFAE03247B5A328FB0BE0A30BE6.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

34DE940442B040E1BBDC8291AC160BD6.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

32BA4F894A344E57B8370F318096C6DC.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

8AAC0188D84B43529304CB707FDF71AF.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

4A7CF048411F4200A012A3F8E11CEFF6.description: Recognize and name all uppercase and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

CAD42C7D17104A87907058257E4A3CBC.description: Recognize the distinguishing features of a sentence (e.g., first word capitalization, ending punctuation).

1AE3699A607E4FAA911DE38CD308EF5E.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

201BAFD02E2B4884AFF52D4D4CD33909.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

58B5BB77D9C24152BC987171D5A3D4F9.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print by recognizing the distinguishing features of a sentence (e.g., first word, capitalization, ending punctuation).

7E2E1005A04C4630959E4DD44C233507.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

6BE22B3F728B4E03A84CC0B52ED5B644.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity (Literature and Informational Texts)

5969A98A274344DA993ED1BE7A26A9B0.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build in knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

E346BA2330344044A39F6914EE730891.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific cases in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

F25030111E50450BA520041D8A0A4A11.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

93D2244396A74FD29638FABE04E19BAC.description: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas (Literature and Informational Texts)

C2C6D93DAC1A4007A9AC218DEB06412A.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

7FA473E68CD340AD86E3B661114E87EE.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

0FE983B67DE848A1864D14818DF80EBD.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

FBA839CD4D4D4E7E8A96B7F797112088.description: Craft and Structure (Literature and Informational Texts)

A5ADF5EE72404B3F965D25FE058D039A.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

2C1E553EE1854FEF85E79E3526FD0B0A.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development: summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

AF50CF4B50654BA182061FB7F5AD7F54.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it: cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from text.
